value.title: Recursion Programming Exercise: GCD
value.instructions:
The greatest common divisor (GCD) for a pair of numbers is the largest positive integer that divides both numbers without remainder. For function `GCD`, write the missing base case condition and action. This function will compute the greatest common divisor of `x` and `y`. You can assume that `x` and `y` are both positive integers and that `x > y`. Greatest common divisor is computed as follows:
`GCD(x, 0) = x` and `GCD(x, y) = GCD(y, x % y)`.
